com.neovisionaries.android.database

Class BaseOpenHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.neovisionaries.android.database.BaseOpenHelper

  • public abstract class BaseOpenHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    Database open helper with a read/write lock, which is useful when a database needs to be accessed by multiple threads. 
     // A subclass of BaseOpenHelper.
 MyOpenHelper helper = ...;

 SQLiteDatabase db = null;

 try
 {
     // Open the database in read mode. openReadable()
     // acquires a read lock and then opens the database
     // by getReadableDatabase().
     db = helper.openReadable();

     ......
 }
 finally
 {
     // Close the database and release the read lock.
     helper.closeReadable(db);
 }
    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Takahiko Kawasaki

    • Method Detail

      • openReadable

        public android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase openReadable()
        Open the database in read mode.

        This method acquires a read lock first, then calls SQLiteOpenHelper.getReadableDatabase(). If getReadableDatabase() throws an SQLiteException, the read lock is released and the exception is re-thrown. The SQLiteDatabase instance returned by this method has to be closed by closeReadable(SQLiteDatabase), not by SQLiteDatabase.close(). Otherwise, the read lock is not released.

      • closeReadable

        public void closeReadable(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Close a database which has been opened by openReadable().

        This method closes the passed database by calling db.close() and then releases a read lock (even if db.close() failed).

        Parameters:
        db - A database which has been opened by openReadable(). If null is given, nothing is done (any read lock is released).

      • openWritable

        public android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase openWritable()
        Open the database in write mode.

        This method acquires a write lock first, then calls SQLiteOpenHelper.getWritableDatabase(). If getWritableDatabase() throws an SQLiteException, the write lock is released and the exception is re-thrown. The SQLiteDatabase instance returned by this method has to be closed by closeWritable(SQLiteDatabase), not by SQLiteDatabase.close(). Otherwise, the write lock is not released.

      • closeWritable

        public void closeWritable(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Close a database which has been opened by openWritable().

        This method closes the passed database by calling db.close() and then releases a write lock (even if db.close() failed).

        Parameters:
        db - A database which has been opened by openWritable(). If null is given, nothing is done (any write lock is released).

      • getLock

        public ReentrantReadWriteLock getLock()
        Get the internal read-write lock instance.
